definition: lit. four ounces can move a thousand catties (idiom)/fig. to achieve much with little effort
four/4
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
to push aside with the hand, foot, a stick etc/to dial/to allocate/to set aside (money)/to poke (the fire)/to pluck (a string instrument)/to turn round/classifier: group, batch
see 鞦韆|秋千[qiu1 qian1]
thousand
catty/(PRC) weight equal to 500 g/(Tw) weight equal to 600 g/(HK, Malaysia, Singapore) slightly over 604 g

sentences.english: Foreign exchange security deposit bargain is 42 stir thousand catty develop a financial product.
sentences.chinese: 描述外汇保证金交易是四两拨千斤的衍生金融产品。

sentences.english: What this time rescued the city still to use was 42 dials thousand catties methods.
sentences.chinese: 本次救市仍然采用的是四两拨千斤的方法。

definition: to use softness to conquer strength (idiom)
(idiom) stay clear of the enemy's main force and strike at his weak points
lit. a needle concealed in silk floss (idiom)/fig. ruthless character behind a gentle appearance/a wolf in sheep's clothing/an iron fist in a velvet glove
to win by a surprise move
to borrow sb's authority/to seize an opportunity
to couple strength and gentleness (idiom)
ingenious/clever/ingenuity/artifice
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
a deliberate show of strength as a warning
move/method of use/trick for success
to take advantage of the new situation (idiom)/to make the best of new opportunities
lit. to change something rotten into something magical (idiom)
pinyin: hua4 fu3 xiu3 wei2 shen2 qi2

definition: lit. to besiege 魏[Wei4] and rescue 趙|赵[Zhao4] (idiom)/fig. to relieve a besieged ally by attacking the home base of the besiegers
lit. the soft can subdue the hard
well-tried/time-tested
to gain the upper hand by a show of strength
